intro: Salvia leucodermis, commonly known as white sage, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its gray-green, woolly leaves and spikes of pale blue to white flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a ceremonial plant due to its aromatic properties. Salvia leucodermis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
